name: Corrie Ten Boom
description:
Corrie Ten Boom (1892 - 1983)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Corrie Ten Boom in mp3 format. Known for the book the "Hiding Place" where she smuggled Jewish people during the great World Wars under the Nazi regime. She had a vibrant faith in the Lord Jesus Christ and that showed in her love for others especially the people of Israel. She ended up going to a concentration camp where she suffered greatly and survived to share the story of faith. 

Corrie's faith story and testimony was shared in many settings especially in the 60-70's where she toured all across North America encouraging Christians of how to endure coming persecution. Her ministry was to encourage faith and love in the hardest circumstances.

sermons.title: Authority Over Demons
sermons.description: "We cannot do anything, without Jesus we can do nothing." The bible does not have any suggestions but commandments. Corrie Ten Boom shares on the subject of spiritual warfare through her experience and the scriptures. We must have Jesus as our foundation and only support we stand on as we contend and resist the demons and the evil one in this earth.

sermons.title: Door of Repentance
sermons.description: "God holds the key of all unknown." Corrie Ten Boom shares some of her testimony and the sufficiency of God in all things. She explains and speaks of who is truly those of God and children of God. When we are saved we are all called to bring the gospel over the world.

sermons.title: Effectual Fervent Prayer
sermons.description: Corrie Ten Boom shares some testimony on putting her burden's and cares on the Lord. Also she shares how she had burdens of impatience that she left with the Lord. "There is nothing too great for God's power and nothing to small for His love." This is a excellent teaching on many aspects of prayer.

sermons.title: Gods Love
sermons.description: Through personal experiences and provoking stories, Corrie expounds on the power of God's love as given to believers through His Holy Spirit. In testimony to His faithfulness, she tells of how His love, working in her, freed her from hatred and unforgiveness towards one of the cruelest empires.

sermons.title: How To Forgive
sermons.description: "There is a tremendous need in our day for the ministry of intercession." We are all called to be the children of light in a dark time. Corrie Ten boom shares on the future tribulation to come upon the world and the glorious ending where Christ will make all things new!

sermons.title: Power Over Demons
sermons.description: [i]This recording is poor due to tape quality.[/i] In this message Corrie Ten Boom shows from the scriptures and her practical experience that we are called to have power over demons as a Christian. This message will challange you think differently then you have before.

sermons.title: Power in Prayer
sermons.description: If you would like to be encouraged about your seemingly "unanswered" prayers, listen to this message! There is indeed much "power in prayer!"

sermons.title: Testimony - Part 1
sermons.description: The audio quality isn't the best, but if you have patience to listen carefully to it, I found it to be very edifying. It sounds like Pat Robertson is interviewing Corrie Ten Boom about details of when she was in a concentration camp. It is incredibly interesting because she talks about being able to lead many Jews to trust in Jesus as their Savior before they died in the camps.

sermons.title: The Holy Spirit Gives Power
sermons.description: Billy Graham gives an opening statement at the Lausanne congress 1974 asking for prayer and introduces Corrie Ten Boom in the meeting. Corrie speaks on the need of the Holy Spirit Power in the Christian life. She speaks on how we can have God's boundless resources when we obey the happy commandment to be filled with the Spirit. The Spirit of God gives us the power to be witnesses for the great commission.

sermons.title: The Reality Of The Love Of Jesus Christ
sermons.description: Corrie Ten Boom shares her testimony of walking with the Lord Jesus 75 for years. Her times of struggle in terrible persecutions and imprisonment. What joy and happiness she has recounting her life and walk with the Lord Jesus.

She had a vibrant faith in the Lord Jesus Christ and that showed in her love for others especially the people of Israel. She ended up going to a concentration camp where she suffered greatly and survived to share the story of faith. 

Corrie's faith story and testimony was shared in many settings especially in the 60-70's where she toured all across North America encouraging Christians of how to endure coming persecution. Her ministry was to encourage faith and love in the hardest circumstances.
